p: The studies were divided into two OH approaches observed in the general literature. The first denoted as “classical OH approach” addressed the “management of the disease threats to humans and animals” ([ 30], p. 372); the second, referred to as “extended OH approach” looked into the close interrelationship between humans and animals with ecosystems, environmental health, pathogens, and the broader social, cultural, and economic factors [ [31], [32], [33]].
